case_vignette: a 50-year-old female with no pertinent medical history presents with a two year history of dark spots on the face. she noticed the dark spots when applying make up one day. she denies any pruritus, pain, trauma or use of any new topical skin products. the dark spots have increased in number and may have slightly grown in size. she has not tried any treatments. physical examination reveals brown irregular patchy poorly demarcated macules coalescing into patches on the bilateral zygomatic cheeks with some extension on lateral cheeks.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have been noticing dark spots on my face for the past two years.
Have these spots changed in size, shape, or color since you first noticed them?
Yes, the dark spots have increased in number and may have slightly grown in size.
Do you have any itching or pain associated with these spots?
No, I don't have any itching or pain associated with the spots.
Does your family have a history of similar skin conditions or any other skin diseases?
I have no pertinent medical history to report.
Have you had significant sun exposure or used tanning beds frequently?
I haven't mentioned anything about sun exposure or tanning bed use.
Are you currently taking any medication or have you taken any in the recent past?
No, I haven't used any new topical skin products or medications.
Have the dark spots appeared symmetrically across your face?
Yes, the dark spots have appeared symmetrically on the bilateral zygomatic cheeks and have some extension on the lateral cheeks.
**Final Diagnosis:** Melasma
